title: Davidic Covenant
objective: Identify key elements of the Davidic covenant

required_passages.text: Now therefore so shalt thou say unto my servant David, Thus saith the LORD of hosts, I took thee from the sheepcote, from following the sheep, to be ruler over my people, over Israel: And I have been with thee whithersoever thou wentest, and have cut off all thine enemies out of thy sight, and have made thee a great name, like unto the name of the great men that are in the earth. Moreover I will appoint a place for my people Israel, and will plant them, that they may dwell in a place of their own, and move no more; neither shall the children of wickedness afflict them any more, as beforetime, And as since the time that I commanded judges to be over my people Israel, and have caused thee to rest from all thine enemies. Also the LORD telleth thee that he will make thee an house. And when thy days be fulfilled, and thou shalt sleep with thy fathers, I will set up thy seed after thee, which shall proceed out of thy bowels, and I will establish his kingdom. He shall build an house for my name, and I will stablish the throne of his kingdom for ever.

segments.audio_script: This is lesson eighteen. You are studying the Davidic covenant. Lesson seventeen examined the establishment of kingship.

Also the LORD telleth thee that he will make thee an house. And when thy days be fulfilled, and thou shalt sleep with thy fathers, I will set up thy seed after thee, which shall proceed out of thy bowels, and I will establish his kingdom. He shall build an house for my name, and I will stablish the throne of his kingdom for ever.
David wishes to build temple for God. God refuses but makes covenant with David. The covenant establishes David's dynasty perpetually. Promise extends beyond David to his descendants.

The Davidic covenant adds dynastical element to Israel's covenant theology. David's throne is established forever. This becomes basis for messianic expectation. The covenant is unconditional and eternal.
Key themes: Davidic covenant is dynastic. Messianic promise expects descendant of David. Throne is established eternally. King mediates covenant blessing.
What does God promise to David?
This completes lesson eighteen. You studied the Davidic covenant. Next lesson examines the temple and centralized worship.

vocabulary.definition: God's covenant with David establishing his dynasty eternally and forming basis for messianic expectation
Expectation of future descendant of David who will fulfill God's redemptive purposes

study_notes: The Davidic covenant bridges Old and New Testament. Jesus is presented as the ultimate fulfillment of messianic promise through David's lineage.
